resources.string: Welcome to Screenplay!\n\nThis is the initial Scene. Press the home button to navigate the other sample Scenes.
Creating simple page flows with Screenplay is easy. Going from one scene to another is as easy as calling Flow#goTo(newScene).
The Transformer class handles animations between scene views. The incoming and outgoing scenes each get a separate animation.
When the animation completes, the old scene\'s view is removed from the window to free up memory.
You can use Flow to add multiple scenes to the backstack at once, or move to a new backstack entirely.
This is the first scene added to the backstack.
This is the second scene added to the backstack. Press the back button to go back once, or the button below to go back twice.
This is the first (root) scene of the new backstack.
This is the second (topmost) scene of the new backstack.
Modals in Screenplay are just Views, and are 100% customizable. Click through to see the examples.
This is a modal scene that looks like a dialog. Like all modal scenes, it will persist even if you add a new scene to the stack.
In this example, we pass a callback to a Scene and fire the callback when the view is detached.
Screenplay will retain the state of the backstack, even on device rotation. Try it!
